Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the money
Reviews.Author: Warp Spedo
Reviews.Content: This laptop is probably the best bang for your buck out there right now. I purchased this laptop because I needed a portable computer to take with me to classes for notes so I figured almost anything would do, which lead me to the lower end of the price scale. The first thing I noticed is how beautiful the screen is. The color depth is spot on and everything looks sharp. Performance wise this guy has a dual core, hyper threading Intel i5 with 8 GB of ram, I have yet to see it lag at all. Other features include Bluetooth technology and a 750 GB hard drive separated in to 2 partitions which allows the OS to be recovered without removing data on the 2nd partition.The only drawback to this laptop for most is that it comes with Windows 8 on it which most people aren't liking quite yet. However with a start menu replacement program that allows booting straight in to the desktop I think that Windows 8 becomes acceptable at the least.

Reviews.Title: Solid purchase for Computer Science major
Reviews.Author: Mark Engstrom
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop going into my junior year of college as a Computer Science major. I was looking for something that could handle a variety of tasks such as some gaming (Minecraft and League Of Legends), programming, and entertainment (streaming movies/music). I have been using the laptop and am very pleased with my purchase with 2 minor exceptions.The first thing I am unhappy with is the location of the speakers. I don't use my speakers for more than some music and movies, but the speakers on this laptop are on the bottom of the unit so that the sound is fairly muted. This is a bigger problem when using the laptop on something like a bed than it is if the laptop is on a hard surface. Turning the volume up a few notches can help solve the problem, but it is a little frustruating at first.The second thing I an unhappy with is the location of the USB drives. All 3 USB drives are directly next to each other on the left side of the laptop. This really isn't a huge deal, but I was using a wired mouse at the time and it was messy running a cord from the left USB around the back to use a mouse. I just bought an inexpensive wireless mouse so this should no longer be a problem.Both of these problems are small details and can be averted by simply using the laptop on a hard surface, turning up the volume a bit, or using a wireless mouse. The i5 processor and 5400 rpm hard drive help the laptop continue to run fast even when handling heavier loads while the 17.3 inch screen allows me to have multiple programs open on the screen at the same time. I would recommend this laptop to anyone looking for a fast 17 inch laptop.

Reviews.Title: Very nice laptop.
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: This laptop is really great.  The only things I would like improved are:1.  To have USB ports on both sides.  It has 3 USB ports and they are all located on the left of the keyboard.2.  I wish the left click part of the mouse were a little longer than the right click side.  I often hit the right when I intend on hitting the left click.3.  It would be nice if the numlock key and the capslock key would light up when activated.4.  The speaker is not very loud at all.Other than these small things, it works great and I love it!  It is fast and the screen is big and has great color and resolution.

Reviews.Title: The ASUS X75A-DS51
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: I have owned multiple laptops and so far, this one is in my top 3 especially at this price range.  I did a lot of research before purchasing and for what you get out of the box and compared to others is excellent.  Nice bright display with good color depth.  Performance wise it has a dual core, hyper threading Intel i5 with 8 GB of Ram.  Compared to some other brands, you're going to pay a little more. The audio sounds goods, but I prefer headphones probably like most.  The battery life could be a little better lasting in the 4-5 hour range with use. Now the biggest reason for the 4 rating is the 10key is a little awkward in it's placement there needs to be a little bit of a gap from the main keyboard, the touchpad takes some getting use too, there is a little more of the bloatware on it then probably some (I just uninstall it) and of course it's Windows 8 which is down right awful.

Reviews.Title: laptop just what i needed
Reviews.Author: T. Carter "tncinc"
Reviews.Content: im very happy with the asus. i converted it to windows 7 with no problems. it is networked and "purring" along.

Reviews.Title: I like it a lot!
Reviews.Author: Saysayy
Reviews.Content: Ok so I've only had the computer for 2 weeks but so far I love it! I had an hp laptop before but it was such a piece of crap, it eventually burned itself out after only 2.5 years, so getting a tough computer that would last a lot longer was what I was striving for and I got it with this laptop. As far as the review saying the disc drive runs constantly, they must have gotten a bad apple because it really doesn't. This computer is super quiet, and never gets hot. I don't do any hardcore gaming or anything though. I use it to watch movies on my tv via an HDMI cord, which works awesome, and for work so all of the storage really helps. I like that you can turn off the computer screen while connected to the tv so you can focus on the tv. It looks a lot sleeker in person than in the picture. The screen quality is great, it comes with a warranty from Asus, windows 8 is annoying but I always use the desktop app. Quirks- I do hear the disc drive engage randomly but it sounds like one spin, its not noisy or constant just a little zip and its gone. Also, the keyboard took me some getting use to but I think thats a personal thing. Lastly, the mouse pad is sensitive and hard to control but I have always used a little mouse with my computers so it doesn't bother me at all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Computer
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: A very high quality computer. I have had no problems (aside from my dislike of windows 8) and have found it smooth performing, quiet, and it runs at an amazingly cool temp. I mean I can run a game, surf the web, listen to music and the computer only just barely seems to warm up making it a very lap friendly laptop compared to my previous which would sing your pubic hair off.. I would recommend this computer to any interested.

Reviews.Title: We liked this computer at first but then
Reviews.Author: Sally M.
Reviews.Content: the video part  went out just a couple months after we purchased it. We had to send it back for repair. Again, everything seemed okay but 6 weeks later the same problem. Fine lines appear on the video and no picture. Finally, got it back yesterday but its been a hassle. The company isn't that easy to contact and after 2 breakdowns they weren't able to expedite our problem or get us a computer to use in the meantime. It's been a bummer!

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Carlos Moyano "carlos moyano"
Reviews.Content: Bought this to bring to class and do some homework on it.  Its fast, efficient and i can even play Dota 2 on it with no issues.  Its a great laptop with great design, big screen and good colors.  Def worth the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Irritating Quirks
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other review posted; for the amount of money spent the screen and specs are really good. Personally I have no issues using Windows 8.My major issue is/was that the dvd drive keeps randomly spinning. I had never placed a disk in the drive. When a computer is first starting up I can understand the drive activating for a moment, but this drive kept suddenly spinning at weird times, like while using Facebook. I verified by virus protection was not scanning the drive, and shut down any background programs that would potentially trigger such an action. Despite doing all of the above, the action persisted. At first I thought it was just a fluke, and exchanged the laptop, but the new one did the exact same thing. So I have just returned it, and am back on the hunt for a computer.A dvd drive spinning may not be a big deal, but this drive is loud. It made it hard to hear sound from the computer, like when watching a video. Plus every time it happened the entire computer would stop for a minute. I found it extremely annoying.Another small quirk was the amount of Asus bloatware on the machine. I realize all computers come with some, but there seemed to be more than usual present.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Precise Appraisal Management
Reviews.Content: This laptop has a very nice display, full keyboard and the battery life seems like it will be good. I'm having to adjust to Windows 8, but that is not the computer s problem.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: Great latop but it has low battery life, otherwise its awesome. Why do i need more words? And now good

Reviews.Title: Great product and gift
Reviews.Author: Teresa Lawson
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our daughter going off to college. Margo loved the big screen and it's easy for her to use. The price was good. The sales people were very knowledgeable and everything was as promised even delivery

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: L. Fant
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is my first laptop bigger than 13 inches, and can I just say that it is HUGE! It is great for watching Netflix movies.Laptop runs very fast, with no problems so far. Interface is very smooth, plug and play devices work just fine.Keyboard is actually pretty decent for a laptop - my last Sony laptop had the worst keyboard I've ever encountered in my life. These keys have good spacing and are nice and big.Runs quickly when loading videos, loading games, etc. Was able to migrate all of my stuff from my old laptop through my Windows 8 cloud account - yay!If you're looking for a good laptop at a decent price, this would be a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: Juries still out
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: We've had this for about a week so far to replace an old laptop that burned out after 5 years.  Windows 8 takes some getting used to, but by the end of the night of setting it up and transferring old files, I will say it has mostly won me over.  There are some oddities to get used to like finding the power down button, but it's not bad.As for the laptop, it is great for the price.  It plays all of the games we have currently with no stuttering.  Sims 3 probably being the most resource intensive to give you perspective of what we play.  The biggest complaint I have so far is the lack of a light on the caps lock and num lock as others have mentioned.  It doesn't sound like a big deal until you are trying to figure out why everything is in reversed caps when you accidentally hit the button, but don't see the telltale light to warn you.  The keyboard is comfortable to type on and there is plenty of drive space for what we need.  Office and web activities are all peppy as would be expected.We did have an issue getting on our wireless network when we first set the laptop up.  Windows 8 had a troubleshooting wizard that resolved the issue itself and there have been no problems since to report.

Reviews.Title: Computer is fine, windows 8 is horrible.
Reviews.Author: Stephie
Reviews.Content: I have had this laptop for almost a month now, and I have enjoyed it. But, windows 8 is horrible. My earphone jack literally doesn't work, and apparently it is a windows 8 problem. If you buy this laptop, which is a great laptop, plan on buying a different OS until windows figures this crap out in about two years.

Reviews.Title: would recommend for the $$
Reviews.Author: ss
Reviews.Content: Has a minor issue with the track pad sticking at startup (two finger scrolling) but it comes on eventually. Cant beat the specs for the pricetag.

Reviews.Title: Can't say Yes enough times.
Reviews.Author: GFroD
Reviews.Content: I love this computer. I always try to max out the ram, but with 8 gigs it screams through several open programs, and you never see the hour glass. Very fast processor and wireless connection. I'm going to use it to play drums along with online music. The sound reproduction and volume are great. Don't eat buttered popcorn while you're using it.

Reviews.Title: Mostly great, a few hiccups
Reviews.Author: Pamela Sullivan
Reviews.Content: My new ASUS runs really great. It's super fast, and I got it at a great price. The only problem that I do have with it is the touch pad mouse.  There is no division between left and right click, so there is a lot of mis-clicking going on at my house these days.  It would've been great to have had it have two separate keys so that that doesn't happen.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: bankbarbie
Reviews.Content: you will be using windows 8.  At first, as with anything new, you want your windows 7 back.  But with time there really isn't any problem.  So far so good.

Reviews.Title: THE PERFECT COMPUTER
Reviews.Author: Matthew P.
Reviews.Content: THE ONLY THING I WOULD CHANGE AND I HAD IT FOR A MONTH OR BETTER NOW IS THAT IT DOESNT HAVE ANY LIGHTS THAT LET YOU KNOW IF YOU HAVE THE CAPS NOR NUMERIAL LOCK ON BUT ITS NOT HARD TO FIQURE THAT OUT

Reviews.Title: laptop
Reviews.Author: Dan Antes
Reviews.Content: This was bought as a gift.  So far it works great.  The only problem is on the warrantee we did not know where to send it and from whom she got it from.  Because of this I don't know if we will buy another laptop here

Reviews.Title: Asus Laptop
Reviews.Author: Donna Fox
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  Not sure I like the newest version of Windows, but the laptop is really nice.  Goo choice!

Reviews.Title: ASUS laptop
Reviews.Author: Nadine W. Martin
Reviews.Content: My 3-star rating may reflect more my frustration with Windows 8 than the machine itself.  I tried to link it to a friend's projector for my video presentation, but my ASUS wouldn't "talk" to his projector.  So we had to disconnect mine and use his to laptop, so I could do my presentation.  I may change my mind, but as of now, I loathe Windows 8 and am thinking about installing Windows 7.  I may change my mind as I work (struggle?) with Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Annoying!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "rapacious bibliophile"
Reviews.Content: If it were not for the fact that i can not turn off the touchpad, this would this be an excellent laptop, especially for the price.  But it does not seem that ASUS wants to support this laptop, at least not as far as the downloads go.  If you are a touchpad user, then this is for you, if not, and like me, you use a mouse, then the overly sensitive touchpad will become the bane of your existence!

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Kristin Miller
Reviews.Content: So far it's working great.  It's fast and sleek. Nice large screen, great quality picture. No complaints so far.  I'm very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Not so good
Reviews.Author: Glint of Hope
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son, but the headphone jack did not work. We kept it for a couple of weeks and realize that we could not deal with it. My son also complained that it would often and suddenly update in the middle of him working on it. He would have to wait until it rebooted before he could continue working. We decided to return it.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8  I hate
Reviews.Author: Steve Noonan
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 SUXs. Windows 8 is difficult to operate the screen changes without my input. Windows 8 is not user friendly. I'm told there is an application I can download FREE that will make Windows 8 look like 7. What is stardock can I get it FREE? I deserve it FREE for all this frustration. I still have until March 16th to send this PC back.I'm a Retired Mechanical QA/QC Engineer; I started working with computers in 1975. Windows 8 SUXs.

Reviews.Title: Must have received a "bad one"
Reviews.Author: Steve Emmert
Reviews.Content: You know things aren't going well when in the first week of using a brand new computer you get the dreaded "Blue Screen" three times!  Thus was my experience with this particular unit.  I loved the look, feel, speed, and overall "package" the Asus 17" laptop had.  It's just that . . . well I hate to blame the O/S but Since Bill Gates is providing a fix free maybe it is the O/S!  I called the most excellent customer service and even tholugh they said that they had another one they'd get to me right away, my schedule would not allow me to take the necessary time to set up the computer again.  I am a full time student and I also work full time, hence the time constraints.  So I purchjased a 22" LCD ASUS monitor and a wireless keyboard. instead of another computer.  Turns out the investment is less. and the screen is BEAUTIFUL on the new monitor!

Reviews.Title: my son likes it
Reviews.Author: Roger Canales
Reviews.Content: my son likes it for school.  he is in High school and uses it for several classes,  he has had it for a month,
